item.title: Pluck Preview - Hum4n01d [WIP]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Hum4n01d:

When you say rezzy, do you mean the freak bass?

Yup, that buzzing element. Generally associated with the use of sawtooth waveforms in synthesis.

Also, what do you think would make the beat better?

Dunno, just keep evolving it.

 

stereofield:

you mean, your $50

The true value is incalculable.

item.description:
I like the beginning and how it has a

pluck

Buildup is good. When it drops down to the high pluck it sounds wrong, like the notes are sustaining too long. If you couldn’t fix this by editing the settings i’d switch to a different instrument. I would have more but the song is pretty short

item.title: Pluck Preview - Hum4n01d [WIP]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
MisterMaster:

Feel like it needs a split second of silence or a different / interesting sound at that point.

I agree. As an alternative, I’d try adding a single, bar, inserted in-between the build-up and the drop.
I’d try leaving the pluck in there as the only sound*, then slam everything back in when the real drop kicks in.

* During that one in-between bar, I’d mess with the effects on the pluck sound, filtering, reverb, delay, possibly even a sliding pitch bend (though that one might be a little cheesy).

Something to try for that 1-bar in-betweener…
Duplicate that instrument/pattern and have one pitch bend up one note over the length of the bar – and have the other pitch bend down one note of the length of the bar. Will end up dissonant, but could be interesting. You’ll get some nice detuning happening along the way.

That interruption to the 8-bar cycle can help build up a little extra anticipation for when the drop kicks in properly.

When the drop kicks in, I’d swap out the pluck sound with something more aggressive, using the same pattern/melody.
You have the bassline underlying the pluck melody, and that’s quite rezzy. Keep that bassline underneath, but swap out the light pluck with another more aggressive, rezzy lead sound could inject some real energy. Or throw on some layers to make a rich lead.

Currently, the pluck sound has its own decay/release, so notes overlap slightly (the tale of one note overlaps the start of another. For contrast, if/when the rezzy lead kicks in, try to make it effectively monophonic, so the decay/release is much more abrupt. It’ll make it more ‘active’, less smooth.

Btw, like the tribal beats. Needs work, but nice directional choice.

My 2¢.

Read full topic

item.title: Pluck Preview - Hum4n01d [WIP]
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Sweet track. Nice build up to the drop.

You requested feedback:

  1. There’s a tiny volume drop near the start that could be removed (@ 8 secs).

  2. The build up’s really good, but the payoff at the drop (34 secs) could be strengthened. Feel like it needs a split second of silence or a different / interesting sound at that point.

Read full topic
